channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Undocumented immigrants provide up to 20% of labor in key industries: Goldman
Steel company shares are surging on 25% tariff plan
BP shares soar after hedge fund Elliott is reported to have taken a stake
The ‘nice’ CEO is no longer en vogue as business pressures reshape leadership styles
item.description: CEOs like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg are adopting aspects of Jack Welch's high-intensity, performance-focused management style.

item.title: U.S. and China have hit each other with tit-for-tat tariffs for years. Here’s the history since Trump’s first term
item.description: The rapid-fire shots of tariffs and import curbs hearken back to Trump’s first term in office, when the U.S. and China engaged in a trade war.

item.title: Did you win a Super Bowl bet last night? The income is taxable.
Inside CEOs’ Trump tariff war rooms
item.description: Also: MicroStrategy’s market value defies logic, Ackman causes Uber stock jump.

item.title: Some Fortune 500 CEO’s in Europe secretly envy Trumpism—is it time to cut the red tape?
item.description: Some European business leaders are asking the question, is it possible to make a similar move towards deregulation as in the U.S.?

item.title: Trump’s new executive order establishing a White House ‘Faith Office’ signals his religious advisors’ increasing sway
item.description: Donald Trump said at his inauguration that he had been "saved by God." Now he appears to be returning the favor with an increasingly conservative, rel...

item.title: Bond market sends a message about Trump’s second term. Investors should listen.
